sentences: Harry Arnold Persson (August 7, 1920 in Helsingborg, Sweden – February 11, 1971 in Stockholm) was a Swedish jazz saxophonist and bandleader.
Arnold led his first big band in 1942, playing the saxophone initially but eventually ceasing to perform to concentrate on arranging.
From 1949–1952, he played and arranged for Thore Ehrling's band and worked extensively as a studio musician, particularly writing film scores through much of the 1950s.
From 1956 to 1965, Arnold led the Swedish Radio Big Band, which included Arne Domnérus, Bengt Hallberg, and Åke Persson.
The group disbanded in 1965, after which Arnold continued work as an arranger and led big bands in Europe.
He died in 1971 at the age of 51.
